author: Steven Russolillo
title: Asian Stocks Near 2-Month High as Malaysia’s Markets Topsy-Turvy
text:
Monday’s big theme: Malaysian markets re-opened after new Prime Minister Mohamad Mahathir’s stunning upset in the country’s elections, renewing volatility in stocks, bonds and currency.
What happened: Malaysian stocks had a volatile start after being closed for two days last week following the vote, which forced former Prime Minister Najib Razak from office. The benchmark index dropped as much as 2.7% before quickly bouncing back and trading in positive territory by midday. As the chart shows, the move was unusually large....
